creator: denovous@hotmail.com
text:
206 requests for partial content from tomcat 4.0 b7's HTTP11 connector seems 
to be miscalculating the "Content-Length:" response header. The "Content-
Length:" header is always returning the complete requested file size, and not 
the size of the byte range returned. 
   When requesting a section from a file 8000 bytes long using the range: 2000-
7999, the "Content-Length:" header is coming back as 8000 when it should be 
6000. I've tested two automatted download programs (reget & download 
accelerator) that use 206 partial content request, and this breaks their file 
requests; and will most likely also effect other programs depending on 
the "Content-Length:" calculations for this type of request.

Yes, indeed. It wasn't causing and problem with GetRight nor WinAMP (it uses 
ranged requests with HTTP/1.1 for efficient seeking), so I missed it. A lot of 
programs could have worked fine, since the content-range header already 
included all the information they needed.
